alert.note: Alert for Bracken (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 12:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN BRACKEN, SOUTHERN BROWN, ADAMS, PIKE, SOUTHEASTERN HIGHLAND, NORTHWESTERN SCIOTO AND SOUTHERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 130 PM EDT... At 1247 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles north of Bainbridge to near Georgetown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Georgetown, Waverly, West Union, Piketon, Peebles, Ripley, Augusta, Winchester, Marshall, Sardinia, Seaman, Bainbridge, Belfast, Highland Holiday, Pike Lake, Kincaid Springs, Rocky Fork Point, Cynthiana and North Folk Village. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northern and northeastern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
